Property Description:

2575 Le Conte is an 11 unit complex offering a mix of studios and 1 bedroom apartments. This early 1920's building features beautiful Victorian inspired aesthetics. Le Conte's exquisite detail sets itself apart from run of the mill apartment buildings. A vertical row of sweeping bay windows, an elegant arched vestibule, and intricate cornice work all boldly characterize Le Conte. 

Large cathedral windows let in soft light and illuminate the warm hardwood floors. Spacious living areas are enhanced with wood trim detail. You'll find all the modern amenities, such as gas stove, refrigerator, and large walk-in closets. The onsite laundry facility ensures you don't spend nights at a laundry mat, and off street parking means you'll never have to circle the block hoping for a spot.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

We are currently looking for a Resident Manager for the Leconte Walk Apartments, a 11 and 6 unit apartment community. 17 Units total in 2 buildings next to each other. 

Compensation: The position receives $1,000 compensation as discount on rent. The apartment rents for $1,995, after credit, rent will be $995.  The position requires the up to 15 hours per week of work and availability.

Accommodations: 
 This unit is a charming studio unit on the ground floor. The building has washer and dryer and  Parking etc. 

The position requires that the person has a mix of management skills. The following are the required duties:

Repairs: The Resident Manager will perform light repairs, as well as coordinating unit improvements during turnovers.
Janitorial/Minor Maintenance: The entire building, hallways, mail area, laundry room, parking area, decks ect,  need to be kept clear of trash and should be cleaned daily. In addition, the front of the building and hallways should be swept periodically. 
Trash and Recycling: Trash area cleaned daily. Recycling containers brought to the street and back to the building when emptied. Old News papers picked up daily as well as junk mail and other trash. The front of the building needs to be periodically watered and weeds need to be pulled.
Leasing: When there are vacancies in the building, the Resident Manager will help the off-site Leasing Agent to show apartments to prospective renters. This will include fielding phone calls and emails, showing apartments as needed and taking applications. 
Handle After Hours Emergencies: In the event of an emergency, the Resident Manager will contact the appropriate vendor and be available to let the person in the affected unit(s). Meet with Utilities for Installs: Facilitate access for PGE, Cable, etc as needed. - Deliver Notices: 24 hour notices posted on doors. Resident manager performs duties such has changing light bulbs, smoke detector batteries etc.
Tenant Relations: The resident manager will be responsible for helping deal with resident disputes and complaints, noise issues and be the first line of defense for resolutions.


Applicants should have the following skills/traits:


Minimum 1 years experience as a resident manager and have some basic handy person skills.
No Criminal Background, no evictions, no drug or alcohol problems.
Ability to communicate via phone or email during normal business hours.
Is generally at home or close by during the day and evenings and weekends.
Likes to interact with their community.
Must maintain a cell phone, computer and printer, and be email savvy.

*Move in funds equal to first months rent and security deposit. *

Compensation:  The compensation credit is subject to federal with-holdings and a w-4/9 is required to be filled out. The position requires a minimum of 10 Hours Per week. Additional hours can be worked for larger projects and are billed at $15 per hour. 

To Apply: (do not attach documents, resumes ect. - emails with an attachment will disqualify you and will be deleted):  Email to: sales @ premiumpd . com 

If you have a sincere interest in the position, please email a description of:

1. who you are and other jobs/activities that you do for income, why are you looking to move to Berkeley?
2. List Experience, skills and ability to perform the job, Willingness to do all the Janitorial Duties. 
3. Resolve situation where residents are complaining about noise from another resident. 
4. Your availability day hours, nights and weekends to put in the hours to do the job.
5. Statement that you have no drug or alcohol problem, evictions, and no criminal background.
6. (respond to 4
situations. a. cycling toilet b. door not latching c. garbage
disposal not working d. low water pressure at sink faucet) 
7. Description of your interpersonal social skills
8. An interesting problem and solution.

perfect for someone who wants to be centrally located and super close to UC

and the Engineering Building are literally a half block away. The North side of

Telegraph Woolsey Holistic Offices


3120 Telegraph Ave, Berkeley, CA, 94705

Property description

Built in the 1920's, the building has some unique and
wonderful architecture with floor to ceilings windows that let in plentiful
natural light. The building's prominent windows open to welcome cool spring
breezes and close to allow the warm autumn light to filter through. The
spacious rooms and hardwood floors, combined with the wonderful natural light,
give each Office a welcoming, homey feel.


The offices are perfect for various health care
practitioners, small businesses, massage therapy, and other holistic services.
These spaces are great for established businesses or for someone who just needs
space to work outside of the house. The offices vary in size from 150 to 700
square feet. There is an eclectic mix of businesses such as holistic healers,
therapists and professionals. The units have hardwood floors, and modern
amenities such as shared and private waiting rooms. The building has numerous
private and shared restrooms.

Telegraph Woolsey Holistic Offices is surrounded by a warm and welcoming garden and is also wheelchair accessible. It is located in Berkeley on Telegraph Avenue @ Woolsey. It is also a short walk from Ashby Bart, College Ave and Alta Bates Hospital.The offices vary in size from 150 to 700 square feet. There is an eclectic mix of holistic services and offices.

Currently, we have a private office available - Suite #3C, which is on a top floor, with window facing Telegraph Avenue. The 264 sq. ft. includes the assigned portion of the shared area in addition to the 158 sq ft of the actual private office space. Additionally, the utilities are billed quarterly on a CAM system and there is currently No Parking Available.

Neighborhood InformationNeighborhood description

This building offers the perfect location: a quiet,
residential area within a couple blocks of a vibrant, bustling neighborhood
full of all the best in dining and shopping options. It is here that you can
walk to Whole Foods, UC Berkeley, BART and numerous cafes and restaurants on
Telegraph Ave, and even up to Rockridge.


This location is close to shopping areas such as Rockridge,
Temescal, Piedmont Ave, Bay Street in Emeryville, U.C. Berkeley, Berkeley 4th
Street shopping, Downtown Berkeley, Solano Ave, Jack London Square, Downtown
Oakland and just across the bay from San Francisco. With no traffic, it's only
15 minutes to Downtown SF driving, or on BART.


For those of you out of area, Berkeley is located in the
center of the East Bay just a short distance to the heart of everything. This
area where the three cities converge to create the Berkeley-Oakland-Emeryville
Corridor which is one of my favorite areas in California for its progressive
cultural attitudes and burgeoning financial development.
